snippet.title: Midnight Puppeteer | Japanese RPG Horror | No Commentary
snippet.description:
"A story of one night to get back a loved one."

* There are some loud sounds. And flashing images and lights.

Game: Midnight Puppeteer (真夜中の人形使い)
Find the game here: https://vgperson.com/games/midnightpuppeteer.htm
Original creator: Mascarpone
Release Date: 2014
Engine: Wolf RPG Editor
I do NOT own anything on this video, all credit to their respective creators.

If the creator wants me to take this down, please tell me.
もしクリエイターがこれを削除することを望むなら、私に言ってほしい。 (DeepL)

Translated by vgperson, this game's weirdly obscure. It hasn't had that much coverage despite you know, vgperson translating it. The one RPG Maker translator most people into it know.

It's not really horror but it's tagged as such on Freem! (I looked) so whatever I can't bother to edit my thumbnail format sorry. It's very mild horror let's go with that.

Also no subtitles for this one. Look at the length and you'll probably understand why. I hesitate on anything that's one hour long let alone three hours long.

This game goes wild after a point. Like what. Why. I do like the game even with it's... weirder elements. I've played it a few times before but this one was the I think first time I didn't use a walkthrough constantly haha. I did use it since I can be dumb. Very much so. 

I don't have much to say as I've played this one quite a few times before but I just wanted to show it since it seems to be not that well known. At least I haven't seen it much.

This game also has weirdly smooth walk animations. For some reason.
